{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3481647,"name":"S. Carvajal","username":"Scarvajal25","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/a6a055/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-14T02:18:50.095Z","cooked":"

Hello, I help with the electronics for our robot and starting last year we used a CANbus made of Spark Max motor controllers. This year we are transitioning to Swerve drive using Swerve Drive Specialties MK4 Swerve Modules and CANcoders. How do I position the CANcoders into the CANbus with the spark max controllers? Then, how do I work on this in the REV Hardware Client?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-01-14T02:32:40.478Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":96,"reads":164,"readers_count":163,"score":507.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":481557,"topic_slug":"cancoders-rev-spark-max-and-canbus","display_username":"S. Carvajal","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71253,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2016"},"post_url":"/t/cancoders-rev-spark-max-and-canbus/481557/1","custom_user_title":"2016","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3481685,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-14T02:52:58.625Z","cooked":"

CANbus is a bus topology and doesn’t care what device types get added to it or in what order. Connect them wherever you see fit to do so.

For the REV Hardware Client, that only supports REV devices, so you wouldn’t be able to use it for CANcoders. You would need to use the Phoenix TunerX application for CTRE devices

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-01-14T02:52:58.625Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":148,"readers_count":147,"score":44.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":481557,"topic_slug":"cancoders-rev-spark-max-and-canbus","display_username":"Fletch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9105,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades"},"post_url":"/t/cancoders-rev-spark-max-and-canbus/481557/2","custom_user_title":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3482321,"name":"philso","username":"philso","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/e68b1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-14T18:25:28.175Z","cooked":"

To clarify, the physical order the devices are connected in doesn’t matter. Every device must be programmed to have a unique CAN ID using the REV Hardware Client or Phoenix TunerX, as appropriate. Devices with duplicated CAN IDs will cause problems.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-01-14T18:25:28.175Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":111,"readers_count":110,"score":27.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":481557,"topic_slug":"cancoders-rev-spark-max-and-canbus","display_username":"philso","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15467,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/cancoders-rev-spark-max-and-canbus/481557/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3483559,"name":"S. Carvajal","username":"Scarvajal25","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/a6a055/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-15T18:11:32.660Z","cooked":"

So the CANcoders need to have IDs as well? I’ve used the REV Hardware client before but never the Phoenix.

Carvajal","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":15467,"username":"philso","name":"philso","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/e68b1a/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71253,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2016"},"post_url":"/t/cancoders-rev-spark-max-and-canbus/481557/4","custom_user_title":"2016","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3483568,"name":"philso","username":"philso","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/e68b1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-15T18:23:09.077Z","cooked":"

The CAN protocol requires every device on a particular network to have a unique ID, regardless of the device type and manufacturer.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-01-15T18:23:09.077Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":71,"readers_count":70,"score":24.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":481557,"topic_slug":"cancoders-rev-spark-max-and-canbus","display_username":"philso","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":71253,"username":"Scarvajal25","name":"S. Carvajal","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/a6a055/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15467,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/cancoders-rev-spark-max-and-canbus/481557/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3483577,"name":"Benjamin Hall","username":"bhall-ctre","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bhall-ctre/{size}/198180_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-15T18:38:33.030Z","cooked":"

Device IDs only need to be unique within a given combination of device type and manufacturer. The FRC CAN device specification includes the device type and manufacturer in the arbitration ID, and CAN only requires that no two devices try to use the same arbitration ID.

As a result, you can have a SPARK MAX with ID 1, a Talon FX with ID 1, and a CANcoder with ID 1 all on the same CAN bus.

Thanks for the correction.

We have been assigning unique IDs to all devices regardless of type and manufacturer to avoid confusion.
